channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: POET: Protocol Optimization via Eligibility Tuning
item.description: arXiv:2602.00370v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Eligibility criteria (EC) are essential for clinical trial design, yet drafting them remains a time-intensive and cognitively demanding task for clinicians. Existing automated approaches often fall at two extremes either requiring highly structured...

item.title: KEPO: Knowledge-Enhanced Preference Optimization for Reinforcement Learning with Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2602.00400v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reinforcement learning (RL) has emerged as a promising paradigm for inducing explicit reasoning behaviors in large language and vision-language models. However, reasoning-oriented RL post-training remains fundamentally challenging due to sparse...

item.title: RobustDebias: Debiasing Language Models using Distributionally Robust Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2602.00405v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Pretrained language models have been shown to exhibit biases and social stereotypes. Prior work on debiasing these models has largely focused on modifying embedding spaces during pretraining, which is not scalable for large models. Fine-tuning...

item.title: PolarMem: A Training-Free Polarized Latent Graph Memory for Verifiable Multimodal Agents
item.description: arXiv:2602.00415v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As multimodal agents evolve from passive observers to long-horizon decision-makers, they require memory systems that provide not just information availability but logical verifiability. A fundamental limitation of current architectures is the...

item.title: Do Latent-CoT Models Think Step-by-Step? A Mechanistic Study on Sequential Reasoning Tasks
item.description: arXiv:2602.00449v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Latent Chain-of-Thought (Latent-CoT) aims to enable step-by-step computation without emitting long rationales, yet its mechanisms remain unclear. We study CODI, a continuous-thought teacher-student distillation model, on strictly sequential...

item.title: UNSO: Unified Newton Schulz Orthogonalization
item.description: arXiv:2602.02500v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The Newton-Schulz (NS) iteration has gained increasing interest for its role in the Muon optimizer and the Stiefel manifold. However, the conventional NS iteration suffers from inefficiency and instability. Although various improvements have been...

item.title: Augmenting Parameter-Efficient Pre-trained Language Models with Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2602.02501v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Training AI models in cybersecurity with help of vast datasets offers significant opportunities to mimic real-world behaviors effectively. However, challenges like data drift and scarcity of labelled data lead to frequent updates of models and the...

item.title: Sparse Adapter Fusion for Continual Learning in NLP
item.description: arXiv:2602.02502v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Continual learning in natural language processing plays a crucial role in adapting to evolving data and preventing catastrophic forgetting. Despite significant progress, existing methods still face challenges, such as inefficient parameter reuse...

item.title: Learning ORDER-Aware Multimodal Representations for Composite Materials Design
item.description: arXiv:2602.02513v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Artificial intelligence (AI) has shown remarkable success in materials discovery and property prediction, particularly for crystalline and polymer systems where material properties and structures are dominated by discrete graph representations. Such...

item.title: What Drives Length of Stay After Elective Spine Surgery? Insights from a Decade of Predictive Modeling
item.description: arXiv:2602.02517v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Objective: Predicting length of stay after elective spine surgery is essential for optimizing patient outcomes and hospital resource use. This systematic review synthesizes computational methods used to predict length of stay in this patient...

item.title: The Hypocrisy Gap: Quantifying Divergence Between Internal Belief and Chain-of-Thought Explanation via Sparse Autoencoders
item.description: arXiv:2602.02496v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) frequently exhibit unfaithful behavior, producing a final answer that differs significantly from their internal chain of thought (CoT) reasoning in order to appease the user they are conversing with. In order to better...

item.title: STEMVerse: A Dual-Axis Diagnostic Framework for STEM Reasoning in Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2602.02497v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As Large Language Models (LLMs) achieve significant breakthroughs in complex reasoning tasks, evaluating their proficiency in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) has become a primary method for measuring machine intelligence....

item.title: Test-Time Detoxification without Training or Learning Anything
item.description: arXiv:2602.02498v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models can produce toxic or inappropriate text even for benign inputs, creating risks when deployed at scale. Detoxification is therefore important for safety and user trust, particularly when we want to reduce harmful content without...

item.title: ROSA-Tuning: Enhancing Long-Context Modeling via Suffix Matching
item.description: arXiv:2602.02499v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Long-context capability and computational efficiency are among the central challenges facing today's large language models. Existing efficient attention methods reduce computational complexity, but they typically suffer from a limited coverage of the...

item.title: Graph-Augmented Reasoning with Large Language Models for Tobacco Pest and Disease Management
item.description: arXiv:2602.02635v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper proposes a graph-augmented reasoning framework for tobacco pest and disease management that integrates structured domain knowledge into large language models. Building on GraphRAG, we construct a domain-specific knowledge graph and retrieve...

item.title: AITO M6 Teased Ahead of Debut as Huawei Executive Says Lineup Is “Complete”
item.description: Huawei has officially teased the AITO M6, completing the brand’s “M5–M9” lineup as the new model targets younger buyers and a spring debut.

item.title: At Least Three Chinese Automakers Expected to Adopt Huawei’s Full Smart-Car Stack This Year
item.description: At least three major Chinese automakers are expected to adopt Huawei’s full smart-car technology stack this year, accelerating the expansion of Huawei-powered intelligent vehicles.

item.title: Spacety Launches A-Share IPO Process, Filling China’s Commercial SAR Satellite Gap
item.description: Spacety has officially launched its A-share IPO process, marking a major milestone for China’s first fully commercialized C-band SAR satellite constellation operator.

item.title: Moore Threads Launches AI Coding Plan Powered by Domestic GPUs
item.description: Moore Threads has launched its AI Coding Plan, combining domestic GPUs, high-speed inference, and the GLM-4.7 model to deliver a fully homegrown AI programming solution for complex development tasks.

item.title: [AINews] Context Graphs and Agent Traces
item.description: a quiet day lets us feature a bubbling topic.

item.title: Dobot Launches Third Batch of Full-Size Industrial Humanoid Robots ATOM, Targets Mass Delivery in 2026
item.description: Dobot has begun mass delivery of its third batch of full-size industrial humanoid robots ATOM for 2026, signaling a major step toward large-scale, real-world deployment of embodied intelligence in manufacturing and commercial scenarios.

item.title: Docker Fixes Critical Ask Gordon AI Flaw Allowing Code Execution via Image Metadata
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a now-patched security flaw impacting Ask Gordon, an artificial intelligence (AI) assistant built into Docker Desktop and the Docker Command-Line Interface (CLI), that could be exploited to execute code and exfiltrate sensitive data. The critical...

item.title: RADICL Raises $31 Million for vSOC
item.description: The company will use the investment to accelerate development of its autonomous virtual security operations center (vSOC). The post RADICL Raises $31 Million for vSOC appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Future of the Global Open-Source AI Ecosystem: From DeepSeek to AI+
RapidFort Raises $42M to Automate Software Supply Chain Security
item.description: The company will use the latest capital to scale its go-to-market efforts and expand its platform’s capabilities. The post RapidFort Raises $42M to Automate Software Supply Chain Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: [Webinar] The Smarter SOC Blueprint: Learn What to Build, Buy, and Automate
item.description: Most security teams today are buried under tools. Too many dashboards. Too much noise. Not enough real progress. Every vendor promises “complete coverage” or “AI-powered automation,” but inside most SOCs, teams are still overwhelmed, stretched thin, and unsure which tools are truly pulling their...

item.title: Hackers Exploit Metro4Shell RCE Flaw in React Native CLI npm Package
item.description: Threat actors have been observed exploiting a critical security flaw impacting the Metro Development Server in the popular "@react-native-community/cli" npm package. Cybersecurity company VulnCheck said it first observed exploitation of CVE-2025-11953 (aka Metro4Shell) on December 21, 2025. With a...

item.title: Critical React Native Vulnerability Exploited in the Wild
item.description: Albeit mainly considered a theoretical risk, the flaw has been exploited to disable protections and deliver malware. The post Critical React Native Vulnerability Exploited in the Wild appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Vulnerability Allows Hackers to Hijack OpenClaw AI Assistant
item.description: OpenClaw (aka Moltbot and Clawdbot) is vulnerable to one-click remote code execution attacks. The post Vulnerability Allows Hackers to Hijack OpenClaw AI Assistant appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: squeezing more metal out of aging mines, and AI’s truth crisis
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. item.title: Hackers Leak 5.1 Million Panera Bread Records
item.description: ShinyHunters has claimed the theft of 14 million records from the US bakery-cafe chain’s systems. The post Hackers Leak 5.1 Million Panera Bread Records appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Training Design for Text-to-Image Models: Lessons from Ablations
When Cloud Outages Ripple Across the Internet
item.description: Recent major cloud service outages have been hard to miss. High-profile incidents affecting providers such as AWS, Azure, and Cloudflare have disrupted large parts of the internet, taking down websites and services that many other systems depend on. The resulting ripple effects have halted...

item.title: Microbes could extract the metal needed for cleantech
item.description: In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. item.title: APT28 Uses Microsoft Office CVE-2026-21509 in Espionage-Focused Malware Attacks
item.description: The Russia-linked state-sponsored threat actor known as APT28 (aka UAC-0001) has been attributed to attacks exploiting a newly disclosed security flaw in Microsoft Office as part of a campaign codenamed Operation Neusploit. Zscaler ThreatLabz said it observed the hacking group weaponizing the...

item.title: Reward-free Alignment for Conflicting Objectives
item.description: Direct alignment methods are increasingly used to align large language models (LLMs) with human preferences. However, many real-world alignment problems involve multiple conflicting objectives, where naive aggregation of preferences can lead to unstable training and poor trade-offs. In particular,...
